metadata.title: CVE-2024-11700 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: Malicious websites may have been able to perform user intent confirmationthrough tapjacking. This could have led to users unknowingly approving thelaunch of external applications, potentially exposing them to underlyingvulnerabilities. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 133 and Thunderbird <133.

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
